meanings.definition: Full of or having knags; knotty; rugged.
meanings.sent1: The knaggy tree branches scratched against the window.
meanings.sent2: The old wooden fence was knaggy and rough to the touch.
meanings.sent3: The knaggy surface of the rock made it difficult to climb.
meanings.sent4: His knaggy hands grasped the rope tightly as he descended.
meanings.sent5: The knaggy texture of the bark resembled a maze of twists and turns.

meanings.sent1: The knaggy roots of the tree peeked out from the ground.
meanings.sent2: The knaggy surface of the fruit made it hard to peel.
meanings.sent3: She tripped over a knaggy root and stumbled forward.
meanings.sent4: The knaggy texture of the fabric caught on the rough surface.
meanings.sent5: The knaggy appearance of the sculpture added depth and character.

meanings.sent1: The hiker struggled to climb the knaggy mountain slope.
meanings.sent2: The knaggy terrain made it challenging for the explorers to navigate.
meanings.sent3: The knaggy path through the forest was full of surprises.
meanings.sent4: His knaggy voice echoed through the empty canyon.
meanings.sent5: The knaggy landscape was both beautiful and treacherous.
